item.title: Ticket #28 (Use 3 type of dates for every post) updated
item.dc:creator: Anne

item.title: Ticket #120 (post_status=static not surviving edit) created
item.dc:creator: stevarino
item.description: I've been working with the new post_status = static setting for a few of my posts in a plugin, and I notice that when a user edits a post through the standard wp editor (using wp-admin/post.php and wp-admin/edit.php) the post_status == draft.

item.title: Ticket #119 ((more...) link not localisable) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: "(more...)" link at bottom of a post cannot be translated using the WP l10n system.

item.title: Changeset [1446]: If the new value and old value are the same, do not update the option ...
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: If the new value and old value are the same, do not update the option in update_option().

item.title: Ticket #118 (Edit timestamp option on post edit page doesn't work for drafts.) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
There is no way to set a timestamp for draft posts. The timestamp is automatically updated anytime the post is edited, regardless of the checkbox state.

This is a problem when manually entering posts set to a specific time. To set and lock the time, the post status must be changed to publish or private, neither of which are ideal solutions.

item.title: Ticket #117 (PHP5 installation) created
item.dc:creator: agolsme
item.description:
As far as I can tell, there is about two lines of code that needs to be changed for wordpress to install smoothly with php5. I am including a patch that can be applied to those 2 lines.

patch -p1 <php5.patch

item.title: Ticket #116 (The function which generate the 'nicename's is broken for unicode) created
item.dc:creator: Tomer
item.description:
I'm about to run a non latin-1 site. While each post is linked with the post nicename, there is no nicename for non latin-1 posts, which gets null strings instead of nicename.

If the system do not like my nicename - it should ask for a manual nicename editing, not to make it null string!

item.title: Ticket #115 (No UI control over category_nicename) created
item.dc:creator: Tomer
item.description: There is no control for the category_nicename from the administration intereface.

item.title: Ticket #114 (Provide the ability to control the sender e-mail address for comment ...) created
item.dc:creator: offline
item.description:
It'd be great to be able to have (as that other blogging system does) the poster's e-mail address as the sender address when comment notifications are sent.

Also being able to modify the e-mail template and subject template would be a nice touch, so that I can more easily distinguish them from one weblog to another, etc...

item.title: Ticket #86 (Plugin Actions do not produce output on bookmarklet.php) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Ok, just to be nice I tried what you asked me to and it fixes half of the problem. The Admin Footer actions are now called, but the Admin Head actions still aren't being called. The header of bookmarklet.php is devoid of the data that should be there if Admin Head is being called.

So, this fixes half, but not everything.
